title: Business Live: EE 'restores full service' - BBC News
summary: ee says full call service restored .
bae systems announces almost 2,000 job cuts .
uk trade deficit widens in august .
domino 's pizza third quarter sales rise 20 % .
uk retail sales boosted by higher prices .
record tourist numbers visit uk in first half of the year .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for another busy day on business live - thank you for staying with us .
do join us again tomorrow from 06:00 for more breaking news , reaction and analysis .

documents.title: sears canada plans closure
text: sears canada has said it will seek court approval to end its business , about four months after it entered creditor protection , citing falling revenues and other problems .
the firm said it expects liquidation to start on 19 october and continue for 10 to 14 weeks , if the court approves the request .

the firm had hoped to reach a deal that would keep it in business , `` but following exhaustive efforts , no viable transaction for the company to continue as a going concern was received , '' sears said .
sears canada was spun out of the us retail chain in 2012 , but the us company remains a large shareholder .
when sears canada filed for creditor protection in june , the firm had 17,000 employees and 225 stores .

documents.title: wall street on the rise
text: the dow jones closed up 69.61 points at 22,830.68 on tuesday , having briefly hit an intraday high earlier in the day .
retail giant wal-mart saw the biggest gain on the dow , up 4.5 % , after it said us online sales would jump by about 40 % in the next tax year .
it also said it would buy back $ 20bn in shares .
the s & p 500 also made gains , rising 5.91 points to 2,550.64 .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq closed up 7.52 points at 6,587.25 .

documents.title: first step in isle of ulva buyout approved
text: a community group has been granted the right to register an interest in buying an inner hebridean island ( see earlier post ) .
the north west mull community trust wants to buy ulva so it can attract new residents and increase economic activity .
the 4,500-acre ( seven-sq-mile ) island is off the west coast of mull .
nicola sturgeon announced that ministers had given consent to the trust to register an interest during her keynote conference speech .
the land reform ( scotland ) act 2003 gives communities the right to register and then go on to buy land and assets under certain conditions .
read the full story here

documents.title: chancellor could face 'difficult decisions '
text: the independent office for budget responsibility has said it expects to `` significantly '' downgrade its forecasts for uk productivity growth over the next five years .
paul johnson from the institute for fiscal studies said that could lead to some `` difficult decisions '' for the chancellor , phillip hammond , when he delivers his budget next month :

if the forecasts go wrong , if it looks like there 's less money around , then it 's going to be harder for him - at least if he keeps to his own self-imposed sets of rules - it 's going to be harder for him to find that money to spend , whether it 's on public sector pay , whether it 's on investment , whether it 's on social security .
but the overall budget position is likely to be less good than was thought at the march budget .

documents.title: why investors like the sound of historic violins
text: demand for passion investments , like owning rare musical instruments , is growing and outstripping the desire to drive a classic car , or buy diamonds and antiques .
investors have tuned into a melodic way of making money and historic instruments are striking a financial chord , as the bbc 's mike johnson explained on world business report .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: mcdonald 's trial vegan burger in finland
text: a mcdonald 's trial of a vegan burger in finland has cooked up some `` promising '' results , with sales so successful the company may offer the mcvegan nationwide .
but people hoping for an animal-free happy meal in other countries will have to wait : the test is specific to finland .
sales are from 4 october to 21 november at five shops in tampere , finland .
`` the first results are very promising , '' spokeswoman heli ryhanen said .
read the full story here

documents.title: equifax apologises again
text: once again , i would like to extend my most sincere apologies to anyone who has been concerned about or impacted by this criminal act .
let me take this opportunity to emphasise that protecting the data of our consumers and clients is always our top priority .

documents.title: why did n't equifax contact uk customers sooner ?
text: it has been regrettable that we have not been able to contact consumers who may have been impacted until now , but it would not have been appropriate for us to do so until the full facts of this complex attack were known , and the full forensics investigation was completed .
i urge anyone who receives a letter from equifax to take advantage of the remedial services being offered to help mitigate against any risk , or to contact us should you have any questions .

documents.title: warning from equifax
text: the credit-scoring firm equifax has said it will be writing to hundreds of thousands of uk consumers potentially affected by a cyber security breach a the firm .
but it has put out this warning that consumers need to be careful when sharing information .

`` we would like to take this opportunity to emphasise that equifax correspondence will never ask consumers for money or cite personal details to seek financial information , and if they receive such correspondence they should not respond .
`` for security reasons , we will not be making any outbound telephone calls to consumers .
however , customers can call our freephone number on 0800 587 1584 for more information . ''

documents.title: who will equifax contact ?
text: more on the equifax data breach now - and in its statement the credit-scoring firm said it would be contacting four groups of uk customers potentially affected by the hacking attack

documents.title: equifax says more brits may have been hit in data breach
text: credit-scoring company equifax has said more uk consumers than previously thought may have been affected by the huge cyber security breach at the firm .
the firm said a file containing 15.2 million uk records dated between 2011 and 2016 was attacked .

it said it needed to contact 693,665 consumers by post , including people who had an email address accessed , people who had their driving licence number accessed and those who had their phone numbers accessed .
previously equifax estimated about 400,000 britons may have had data compromised .
the balance of the 14.5 million records potentially compromised may contain the name and date of birth of certain uk consumers , '' the firm said in a statement .
`` while this does not introduce any significant risk to these people equifax is sorry that this data may have been accessed .
it emerged in september that hackers had gained access to equifax systems by exploiting a `` website application vulnerability '' .
last week , equifax revealed 145.5 million of its us customers might have been affected , up from a previous estimate of 143 million .

documents.title: defence trade body reacts to bae job cuts
text: britain 's leading defence manufacturer , bae systems , has announced plans to cut almost 2,000 jobs across england .
the firm , which makes the eurofighter typhoon aircraft , is facing a drop in demand .
paul everitt is the chief executive of ads group , an industry body which represents the aerospace and defence industry .
he told radio 4 's world at one that `` we definitely need to continue the hard work on securing exports , particularly for the typhoon and hawk '' .
he added `` the role that the government plays in helping to broker and make those export deals easier is really , really important '' .
author: The World at One
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: ee boss says 'full service ' has been restoredmarc allera , ceo of bt 's consumer brands : ee , bt and plusnet , tweets
text: hi all , just want to update you on our call issue today ( 10 october ) , which is now almost fully resolved .
at 10.30am , our network team became aware of a problem with calls to and from landlines and across some mobile connections .
a number of our customers found that calls to and from landlines and across some mobile connections were not going through .
this was due to an error on our interconnect platform , which is responsible for moving calls around the network .
our engineers have been hard at work ever since we became aware of the problem .
we 've been rebooting the landline-to-ip interconnect across major switch sites , which should restore full service by 6pm .
i can confirm full service has been restored .
i know that this has made the day very difficult for some of our customers , and for that i 'd like to sincerely apologise .

you can check the status of your local coverage and sign-up for updates at - rich

and have you spoken to a member of our technical team about this ?
- rich

documents.title: weakness in productivity growth 'striking '
text: the government 's economic watchdog , the office for budget responsibility ( obr ) , has said it expects to downgrade its forecasts for uk productivity growth over the next five years .
the chairman of the obr , robert chote , spoke to the bbc 's economics editor , kamal ahmed .

documents.title: 'dark days of the 1970s '
text: stewart robertson , a senior economist at aviva investors , had this to say on today 's imf report - which predicted uk growth would slow from 1.8 % in 2016 to 1.7 % this year .
it was noticeable that compared to as recently as july , the uk was the only major developed nation not to receive an upward growth revision .
the reasons for this are well-documented , largely the result of weaker consumer spending .
looking further ahead , the imf referred to the highly uncertain '' medium-term outlook , a direct consequence of brexit .
the last time that britain was such a notable underperformer was in the dark days of the 1970s .
let 's hope it is cyclical this time , not structural .

documents.title: advice for ee customers
text: price comparison and switching service uswitch has issued some advice for ee customers who ca n't call users on other networks ( see previous posts ) .
`` customers who are suffering can keep a track of this incident using ee 's own network status checker and ask the provider to keep them posted , '' says mobiles expert ru bhikha .

`` for those needing to stay in contact , it 's worth considering data based calling services like whatsapp , skype or facetime - but it 's worth remembering that heavy use of these services could eat into your data allowance pretty quickly .
`` if you are unhappy with how long the fix has taken , you should follow ee 's formal complaints procedure .

`` if you feel that this is unresolved after eight weeks , you can submit your complaint to the independent alternative dispute resolution ( adr ) scheme - for ee customers that 's ombudsman services . ''

documents.title: hammond 's new budget headache
text: budget day for the chancellor just became a little more tricky .
the announcement by the government 's official economic watchdog that it expects to downgrade productivity growth over the next five years is likely to mean lower tax revenues for the government .
and lower tax revenues mean that reducing the deficit becomes harder .
low levels of productivity are a demonstration of an economy that is not very good at creating wealth .
or wage growth .
for seven of the last 10 years , people have suffered falling real incomes , where earnings growth lags behind price increases ( inflation ) .
this is not a comfortable position for any government to find itself and negatively affects consumer confidence and spending power - the key drivers of the uk economy .
read kamal 's full blog here .
author: Kamal Ahmed
Economics editor

documents.title: ftse closes higher
text: in london the ftse 100 has closed 0.4 % or 30 points ahead at 7,538.27 .
the biggest decline was posted by pearson - down by 1.9 % - while builder persimmon gained 2.34 % , making it the biggest climber .
the ftse 250 edged up by 0.22 % or 44 points to 20,146.28 .
the biggest increase rise was seen by domino 's pizza after it reported an 8 % rise in third quarter sales .
its shares closed nearly 9 % higher .
meanwhile pets at home fell by 8 % after a key shareholder sold some shares .

documents.title: ulva community ownership gets go-ahead
text: more from the snp conference now , and nicola sturgeon says the scottish government has given the people of ulva , an island off the west coast of mull , permission to take the island into community ownership .
the 4,500-acre island was put on the market for £ 4.25m over the summer .
island of ulva ( it 's off mull , btw ) given green light for community ownership by @ twitterid
the uk 's youngest mp absolutely rinsed jeremy corbyn at the snp conference # corbyn # labour # snp17 @ twitterid
so it 's outside the central belt , eh no ?

documents.title: sturgeon turns to childcare , tourism and energysnp leader speaks at party conference
text: nicola sturgeon has pulled a few fiscal rabbits out of her hat during her party conference speech in glasgow .

she said the government would spend £ 840m a year on childcare for working parents , telling delegates : `` by 2020 , we will deliver 30 hours a week for every three and four year old and eligible two-year-olds . ''
ms sturgeon also unveiled a £ 6m rural tourism infrastructure fund , where local communities can bid for cash .
she confirmed plans announced in the snp 's manifesto to create a new publicly-owned energy company .
`` energy would be bought wholesale or generated here in scotland - renewable , of course - and sold to customers as close to cost price as possible , '' she said .
watch live coverage of the speech

documents.title: french unions strike over economic reform
text: millions of public sector workers in france are taking part in a nationwide one-day strike in protest at president emmanuel macron 's economic reforms .
the action has closed schools and disrupted train services and about a third of flights have been cancelled .
the french government plans to cut 120,000 public sector jobs in france over the next five years .
the nationwide strike , called by all nine of the country 's public sector unions , was organised to show solidarity against the job cuts and further plans to freeze pay .

documents.title: ee sorry for ongoing call glitch
text: ee says some customers are still unable to make calls - but explains that emergency calls , mobile data and text messages are working as normal .
the company apologised and says it 's working to fix the problems `` as quickly as possible '' .
can anyone else on @ twitterid not make calls ?
emergency calls , as well as all data and messaging services , are working as normal .
we apologise for any inconvenience caused .

documents.title: walmart leads dow upwards
text: the dow was led higher by retail giant walmart after it announced plans to buy back $ 20bn of its shares .
walmart also said it expected its us online sales would rise by about 40 % in the year to january 2019 , while net sales would increase 3 % .
shares in the retailer are up by nearly 5 % .

documents.title: dow hits all-time high
text: on wall street the dow jones briefly hit a new all-time high on tuesday afternoon .
it rose to 22,850 before falling back again .
it 's now at 22,787.72 , a rise of 27 points or 0.12 % .

documents.title: irish budget at a glance
text: ireland 's taoiseach leo varadkar said today 's budget would n't be a `` bonanza '' - but his government did announce a number of key changes , including :

documents.title: imf says global growth to strengthen
text: the global economic recovery is strengthening , according to the international monetary fund ( imf ) .
in its latest world economic outlook , the imf has revised its forecast for the global economy and is now expecting slightly stronger growth .
it now predicts growth of 3.6 % this year and 3.7 % in 2018 .
the imf 's forecast for the uk is the same as in its july report .
it expects growth to slow from 1.8 % in 2016 to 1.7 % this year and to 1.5 % in 2018 .

although the uk is an exception to the pattern of strengthening growth in the imf 's assessment , for this year and next the growth projections are stronger than two other g7 economies , japan and italy .
read more here
author: Andrew Walker
World Service economics correspondent

documents.title: labour fears for 'future of defence industry '
text: more reaction to the news that bae systems is to cut nearly 2,000 jobs
shadow defence secretary @ twitterid says she is worried about `` the future of the defence industry '' as bae systems plan 2,000 job cuts .
# bae so , big and expensive will not be quite so big - expect it will be just as expensive though !

documents.title: greg clark : bombardier tariffs 'unjustified '
text: speaking in the house of commons business secretary greg clark has called the us tariffs on bombardier unjustified action '' and said the government is doing everything they can to have them thrown out .
boeing has alleged that bombardier is trying to sell its c-series jets below cost price in the us , after taking state subsidies from the uk and canadian governments .
the us department of commerce is investigating boeing 's complaint , and so far it has ruled against bombardier twice , imposing punitive import taxes .
mr clark told mps boeing 's allegation does n't have merit and i expect it to be thrown out '' .
a final ruling on the matter is not due until february .

documents.title: wall street rises ahead of company results
text: all three key us share indexes are ahead at the start of tuesday 's trading .
the dow jones is at 22,839.42 , a rise of 78 points or 0.34 % .
the s & p 500 is at 2,554.42 , 10 points or 0.38 % .
higher .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq is up 23 points or 0.35 % at 6,602.53 .
the rise had been predicted as investors are expecting company results this week to show increased profits .
`` i think it will be a good earnings season , '' said peter cardillo , chief market economist at first standard financial .
`` it will be focused on individual stocks as opposed to earnings season as a whole . ''
blackrock and delta air lines are due to report on wednesday and jp morgan and citigroup on thursday .

documents.title: uk growth 'increased 0.4 % ' in summer
text: the uk economy grew by an estimated 0.4 % over the previous three months , says think tank the national institute of economic and social research .
if its monthly estimate is correct , economic growth would be a nudge above the previous quarter - 0.3 % between april and june 2017 .

but amit kara , niesr 's head of uk macroeconomic forecasting , said : `` activity has slowed since last year at a time when real gdp growth in other major economies such as the euro area and the usa has strengthened . ''

documents.title: 'brexit loan ' for irish businesses
text: ireland 's finance minister paschal donohoe has unveiled a `` brexit loan '' for irish businesses as part of his budget .
the government will set aside €300m ( £ 268m ) to offer small businesses low-cost loans to combat the impact of brexit , he said .
speaking in the dáil éireann , the lower house of the irish legislature , he said the uk 's departure could bring `` permanent changes '' to trade patterns in the country .
`` small and medium businesses will need to change , '' he said .
the irish government is expected to outline £ 60bn in spending plans this afternoon .

we apologise for any inconvenience caused .

the issue was fixed by 6pm .

the issue was fixed by 6pm .
sorry for any inconvenience .

documents.title: small business plea over trade deficit
text: the widening trade deficit is `` worrying '' for the uk 's smaller firms , says mike cherry , chairman of the federation of small businesses .
he says : small businesses , particularly those in vulnerable positions , need additional help and support as they prepare for changes in our trading relationship with the eu .
`` the government needs to do more to encourage exporting , making sure each cog of the supply chain is taken into consideration in any future trade agreements . ''
the fsb 's research shows 21 % of uk small firms are exporters .
`` small firms that export are more likely to survive , grow and innovate - contributing to the uk 's productivity and position as a global trading power , '' he says .

documents.title: hello fresh tries again
text: meal kit firm hello fresh is planning to try and float on the stock exchange again .
the german firm wants to raise €250m to €300m in the flotation that it plans to use for expansion and new business lines .

the public listing marks the next logical step to further expand our business , to secure our position as the leading global player and to pursue our long-term growth strategy , '' says dominik richter , co-founder and chief executive .
the firm originally planned to float in late 2015 , but cancelled the listing because it could n't get the price it was after .

documents.title: walmart confident on year ahead
text: retail giant walmart has forecast that net sales will rise 3 % for the financial year to the end of january 2019 .
the biggest contributor will be online sales , which it expects to rocket by an impressive 40 % .
it also expects profit to increase by 5 % for the same period .
the us chain put out the figures ahead of its annual investor meeting today .

documents.title: how the obr 's forecasts changeda nifty graph on productivity growth
text: how the obr 's forecasts changeda nifty graph on productivity growth

documents.title: vanquis bank fined £ 75,000
text: vanquis bank , the credit card subsidiary of troubled doorstep lender provident financial , has been fined £ 75,000 by the information commissioner 's office ( ico ) for sending illegal marketing texts and emails .
bradford-based vanquis bank sent 870,849 spam text messages and 620,000 spam emails to promote its credit cards .
both the emails and texts broke the law because the recipients had not consented to being sent such messages .
vanquis bank says it is sorry for any irritation this has caused to the individuals concerned , and that it had put in place steps to make sure the issue did not reoccur .

documents.title: bae job cuts due to 'restructuring '
text: business minister claire perry has insisted that the job cuts at bae systems are due to restructuring and `` not related to uk defence spending decisions '' .

responding to an urgent question in the house of commons , ms perry said the government wished to continue to `` procure from bae '' , but said `` it would be wrong for the government to interfere in the company 's restructuring '' .

documents.title: hummus giant dips into london market
text: bakkavor , the uk 's largest hummus-supplier which also stocks ready meals for tesco , waitrose , sainsbury 's and marks & spencer , is to float on the london stock exchange .
the firm , jointly-owned by founders agust and lydur gudmundsson and us hedge fund baupost , hopes to raise £ 100m from the ipo to fund investment and pay down debts .
london-based bakkavor , which is set to list in november , posted £ 1.8bn sales in the 52 weeks to 24 december 2016 , according to its most recent update .

agust gudmundsson , who set the company up with his brother lydur in 1986 , said the flotation would `` ensure we create value for all investors and stakeholders , and bring more great tasting food to our customers '' .

documents.title: pfizer may sell consumer healthcare unit
text: us drugs giant pfizer has said it 's reviewing options for its consumer healthcare business , including a full or partial separation of the unit .

pfizer said the consumer healthcare business , which includes brands such as chapstick , was `` distinct enough '' from its core business that there could be potential for it to be more valuable outside the company .
the division made around $ 3.4bn ( £ 2.6bn ) in revenue last year .

documents.title: vw cuts costs in european dealer network
text: volkswagen plans on shrinking its european dealer network as it tries to shift car sales online .

vw plans to increase `` profitability and efficiency '' at its 3,000 dealers across the continent by around 10 % , chief executive juergen stackmann told reuters - although he did n't reveal when or where the planned closures would fall .
meanwhile the carmaker , which was at the heart of the diesel emissions cheating scandal , is set to pay $ 30bn for fixing engines in the us .

documents.title: gig economy bosses face mps
text: bosses from uber , deliveroo and hermes have said treating their uk contractors as workers would add millions to their costs .
they are currently in front of mps from the business select committee on the potential implications of the taylor review .
published in july , the report recommended that workers for so called `` gig economy '' firms should be classified as dependent contractors , with extra benefits .
hermes said it would cost about £ 58m if contractors had workers ' rights , while uber has put the cost at `` 10s of millions '' and said it would follow up with an exact figure .
deliveroo was also unable to provide figures but said it will follow up .
some five million people are estimated to work in the gig economy , where people tend to work without a fixed contract .

documents.title: oil hits $ 56 a barrel
text: the oil price is trading higher today , with brent crude currently up almost 50 cents to $ 56 ( $ 42 ) a barrel .
saudi arabia has said it will cut its november output by 560,000 barrels a day following an opec agreement to reduce supply .
opec , russia and other non-member producers have agreed to trim output by about 1.8 million barrels per day ( bpd ) until next march in a bid to reduce oversupply and boost prices .

documents.title: pound holds onto gains
text: the pound is still up 0.4 % against the dollar at $ 1.31880 .
but it 's now in negative territory against the euro , down 0.04 % to €1.11870 .
spreadex analyst connor campbell says the disappointing trade data has taken the shine off the better-than-expected manufacturing figures .
`` add onto all that jitters surrounding the fifth round of negotiations between the uk and eu , i.e .
the last meeting before the latter decides whether sufficient progress has been made to start discussing future trade agreements .
`` and news that the ons is going to 'significantly ' downgrade the country 's productivity forecasts , and the pound was a bit inconsistent , '' he says .

documents.title: breakdown of bae job losses
text: in all , 1,915 posts will go across the company 's military , maritime and intelligence services .
here is the regional breakdown :
more on this story

documents.title: kobe steel defies nikkei trend
text: kobe steel was one of the biggest losers on japan 's nikkei 225 after it admitted falsifying data about the strength and durability of its products .
its shares crashed 22 % , to close at 1,068 yen ( £ 7.20 ; $ 9.50 ) - wiping almost a billion dollars off the firm 's market value .
shares in toyota and nissan fell about 0.2 % after they said they were among the companies that used kobe steel materials that could be affected by the falsification .
but these falls defied the upward trend seen in tokyo with the nikkei climbing 0.6 % , rising by 132.80 points to 20,823.51 at the end of trading this tuesday .
hong kong 's hang seng also rose by 0.6 % , closing 164 points higher at 28,490.83 .
author: Ashleigh Nghiem
Business reporter in Singapore

documents.title: bae job cuts : 'deep implications ' for defence
text: shadow defence secretary nia griffith says she is `` particularly worried '' at bae systems ' decision to cut nearly 2,000 jobs .
`` it 's got very very deep implications for the whole of our defence industry and the future of that industry , '' she told the bbc news channel .
ms griffith urged the government to do more to help .
`` now it 's really important that we get ahead of the game , that we have the technological advantage , that 's important for our security as well as for the future of our industry , '' she said .
`` once you lose these skilled workers it 's impossible , really , to restart and to get back up to that level again . ''
author: BBC News Channel

documents.title: 'worst decade ' for productivity growth since 1893resolution foundation economist tweets
text: obr forecast evaluation report is out .
unsurprisingly majors on productivity assumptions given how reality has failed to match expectations
key passages confirm that obr anticipates `` significantly reducing '' assumption for productivity growth at the budget
makes sense given we 're in worst decade for productivity growth since 1893 .
big implications for public finance & living standards outlooks
gdp growth has been significantly weaker than projected ahead of the eu referendum and broadly in line with the nov-16 forecast
business investment in particular has under-performed relative to pre-referendum projections : q2 2017 outturn 6 % down on march-16 forecast
here 's obr 's previous productivity growth projection .
now says nov-17 report will stop short of saying 'no recovery ' but will be sig lower
purely for illustration , note a halving of the obr 's mar-17 forecast would leave productivity ~1/3 lower than pre-crisis counterfactual
a similar halving of wage growth forecasts would leave earnings ~£ 1k below peak , 15 years after start of squeeze
much due to £ 7bn losses from people off sick with work related stress
when economic policy delivers real terms wage cuts for the majority for 7 years this is what you get
i would ban all never-never loans .
only do thorough background checks at the banks .
and stop wasting our pensions on a failed eu project .
and we were more productive in the 70s on a 3 day week than a 40 hour week .
uk hours and presenteeism does n't work
what is the intuition behind this result ?
red tape seems the only thing to bind us together .
tories may claim it was miscalculation , but knowing gove , hunt , ids and rest have proven form for # datafakery i do n't trust them @ twitterid
note reagan/thatcher led to productivity collapse : the complete opposite of the narrative sold to the gullible
stats wise , this is such drivel i hardly know where to start .
since 1795 p is +ve over any and every 10 year interval - good , so what ?

documents.title: trump says nfl getting 'massive ' tax breaks
text: why is the nfl getting massive tax breaks while at the same time disrespecting our anthem , flag and country ?

and will not even answer the phone .

documents.title: uk productivity lower than expected - obr
text: the office for budget responsibility says it has been overly-optimistic about productivity growth in the uk .
its annual forecast evaluation report , published today , said the first half of 2017 had seen productivity fall .
the independent government agency predicted in march that output-per-hour would grow 1.4 % this year and rise to 1.8 % in 2021 .
but it said : `` this has proved yet another false dawn .
`` the renewed weakness of productivity so far in 2017 may in part be a temporary effect of the brexit vote and the uncertainty that it has generated . ''
the obr said it would revisit its assumptions again in november .
read more on this topic

documents.title: nisa agrees to co-op takeover offer
text: nisa has agreed to a £ 143m takeover offer from co-op group .
co-op will also take on £ 105m of nisa 's debt .
the 3,200 nisa stores will keep the nisa brand name .

`` the co-op offers the right blend of buying capability , convenience expertise , and respect for the heritage of our business , to enable our members to fully thrive in this new partnership , '' said the chairman of nisa , peter hartley .

documents.title: no trade 'silver lining ' from weak sterling
text: samuel tombs , uk chief economist at pantheon macroeconomics , says the uk trade deficit is `` awful '' despite the weakened pound .
`` sterling 's depreciation has not had a silver lining , '' he said .
the trade deficit was £ 5.6bn in august - much bigger than the £ 2.8bn predicted by economists .
he said : `` the uk is n't benefiting from a trade boost because exporters have increased their sterling prices by 15 % since the pound 's peak in november 2015 . ''
mr tombs also thought exporters were `` hoarding cash '' due to the risk of brexit .
`` britain 's future trade links are uncertain , '' he said .

documents.title: how to tackle coffee cup waste
text: more than 2.5 billion disposable coffee cups are thrown away each year in the uk , and mps are looking into the issue .
the environmental audit committee 's first oral evidence session , which got under way this morning , said that the materials coffee shops use for their cups are often difficult to recycle .
richard mcilwain of keep britain tidy said : most consumers think that if they put [ a cup ] in the mixed recycling bin it will be recycled but that 's not the case . ''
wouter poortinga , professor of environmental psychology , added : it 's very convenient , we go to a coffee shop , drink it on the way walking to work and we dispose of it . ''
it 's part of the committee 's inquiry into disposable packaging that began in september .

documents.title: expectations raised of november rate hike
text: howard archer is chief economic advisor to the economic forecasting organisation they ey item club .
howard archer
howardarcheruk
aug rise in # uk # manufacturing & # construction output will likely fuel expectations of nov # boe # rate hike despite disappointing trade data
aug rise in # uk # manufacturing & # construction output will likely fuel expectations of nov # boe # rate hike despite disappointing trade data

documents.title: trade data 'disappointing '
text: the trade data for august is `` disappointing '' says british chambers of commerce head of economics suren thiru .
she says it signfies `` a much weaker trading position '' than normal for the time of year .
the latest trade data is further evidence that the decline in sterling 's value over the past year is doing little to boost the uk 's overall trade position , '' she says .
she say for firms the weak pound is `` hurting as much as it 's helping '' .
`` firms [ are ] continuing to face higher input costs due to the weakening currency , particularly those locked into global supply chains .
`` for those companies that rely on overseas suppliers for their production equipment , a weak pound also makes investment in growth less viable , '' she says .

documents.title: analysts bet on rate hike
text: the manufacturing data 's strength - with july and august marking the strongest two months so far this year - means a november interest rate hike is still likely , analysts believe .
`` they 're not storming figures but i think they 're good enough to keep the bank of england on track for a november rate hike , '' said victoria clarke , an economist with investec .
she said revisions to past data which showed a stronger than previously thought for manufacturing and the broader industrial sector would also add to the case for a hike .
most economists think rates could rise as soon as 2 november , when the bank announces the outcome of its next meeting .

documents.title: pound spikes after uk data
text: the pound strengthened after strong data on uk manufacturing .
it traded close to $ 1.32 against the dollar , up almost half a cent for the session .

documents.title: bae : the right thing to do
text: bae systems chief executive says the organisation shake-up is the `` right thing to do '' .
`` those actions are necessary and the right thing to do for our company , but unfortunately include proposed redundancies at a number of operations .
`` i recognise this will be difficult news for some of our employees and we are committed to do everything we can to support those affected , '' he says .

documents.title: bae systems to cut 1,915 jobs
text: bae systems has confirmed that it will be cutting jobs .
it plans to cut up to 1,400 roles in its military air & information business .
it also plans 375 job cuts in its maritime services business .
the applied intelligence business will also cut up to 150 roles .

documents.title: japan 's kobe steel shares crash
text: shares in kobe steel crashed more than 20 % after it admitted falsifying data regarding the quality of its products .
japan 's third largest steelmaker admitted over the weekend that it had shipped aluminium and copper products that did not meet client specifications .
toyota was among 200 clients which may have received aluminium and copper products that involved fabricated data , including the strength of those products .
japan 's government has asked kobe steel to check for any illegal processes that could impact the safety of its customers products .
author: Ashleigh Nghiem
Business reporter in Singapore

documents.title: trade deficit almost doubleseconomics reporter andrew verity tweets :
text: if you take the overall uk trade deficit it nearly doubled to £ 13.2 billion - but ons says that 's down to distortions caused by gold
also odd that export growth was down when other signals indicate strength
that can just be internal consumption rather than export
the surveys specifically stated exports
sorry i thought it was in activity rather than just exports my mistake
the trade deficit ( excluding erratic commodities ) widened by £ 2.9 billion to £ 10.8 billion in the 3 months to august

documents.title: uk industrial output rises in august
text: uk industrial output rose 0.2 % in august according to figures from the office for national statistics .
that was in line with economist 's forecasts .
a fall in the output of mines and quarries , was offset by gains in manufacturing .
in particular , the output of metal and metal products saw growth .

documents.title: trade deficit widens
text: official stats show that the trade deficit has widened in the three months to august by £ 6.2bn to £ 13.2bn .

the office for national statistics says the increase is largely due to the movement of `` erratic commodities '' such as gold which it says can have a large impact on the headline figure and make it difficult to see the underlying trend .
`` users are advised to put more emphasis on the uk trade excluding erratic commodities balance , '' it says .
so excluding erratic commodities , the trade deficit widened by £ 1.7bn to £ 4.6bn between july and august .

documents.title: pound up ahead of trade data
text: the pound has continued its rise from yesterday .
it 's currently up 0.32 % against the dollar at $ 1.31830 and 0.05 % against the euro at €1.11970 .
the question is will the pound continue to stay up after official industrial output , construction and trade data are released soon .
all the figures will be closely watched to see if they 'll prompt a change of heart from the bank of england .
the central bank has given plenty of strong hints that we can expect interest rates to rise soon , with most economists expecting an increase at november 's meeting .

documents.title: budget tourists flock to easyhotel
text: demand for no-frills accommodation has boosted easyhotel , where total sales increased 39 % to £ 29.7m in the year to 30 september .
easyhotel , set up by easyjet founder stelios haji-ioannou in 2005 with rooms from £ 20 a night , owns and leases 25 hotels across the world .
like-for-like revenue at its owned hotels increased by 13.7 % and franchised hotels by 8.6 % , as boss guy parsons said tourists liked its `` comfortable , affordable accommodation '' .
easyhotel , listed on london 's junior stock market aim , opened five hotels in the past year and is building new ones in lisbon , reading , belfast and dubai .

documents.title: lvmh shares near record high
text: shares in luxury retailer lvmh are closing in on a record high .
it 's the top performer on france 's benchmark cac-40 index with shares up 1.8 % nearing a record high of €239.65 reached in may .

the french firm , home to labels such as louis vuitton , christian dior and moet & chandon champagne , reported earlier that third-quarter like-for-like revenues , which strip out new store openings , grew 12 % from a year earlier to €30.1bn .

`` given lvmh 's size and diversity , the continued strong growth in 3q despite tougher comparisons signals a positive demand environment amongst luxury consumers that is encouraging for the broader luxury sector , '' goldman sachs said .

documents.title: ftse 100 flat
text: despite the flurry of results out this morning , so far the ftse 100 has barely reacted .
it 's currently up just 0.14 % , or 10 points , at 7,518.38 .
domino 's pizza is the top riser following its strong third quarter , while pets at home is the biggest faller .
the pet retailer 's shares are currently almost 9 % lower after private equity firm kkr sold a big chunk of shares .

documents.title: liberum urges caution on domino 's
text: domino 's shares have surged over 10 % following the pizza chain 's strong third quarter .
but analyst firm liberum has urged caution saying it 's just one quarter .
`` there are a number of reasons why this performance could merely be driven by adverse weather and poor comparatives - nothing else has changed in our view , '' it says .

documents.title: new capita boss : 'there is work to do '
text: jonathan lewis , who is set to take the top job at capita this december , admits there is `` work to do '' at the ftse 250-listed outsourcer .
he is set to replace chief executive andy parker , who resigned in march after a fall in profits at the company , with finance boss nick greatorex acting as interim chief executive in the meantime .
former amec foster wheeler boss mr lewis said capita , which operates the london congestion charge and collects bbc licence fees , had `` tremendous potential '' .
shares are currently up nearly 2 % to £ 5.73 .

documents.title: it 's ada lovelace daytech reporter zoe kleinman explains :
text: today is # adalovelaceday , a celebration of women doing fantastic work in male-dominated # stem ( science , tech , engineering , maths )

documents.title: robert walters to beat profit forecasts
text: recruitment firm robert walters says profit for the full year will be better-than-expected after a record third quarter .
it says net fee income was up 21 % in the three months to the end of september with the uk , us and asia all seeing a strong rise in fees .
`` growth was broad based across permanent , contract , interim and recruitment process outsourcing .
`` the board is therefore confident that profit before tax for the full year will be ahead of current market expectations , '' it says .

documents.title: thirst for local beers boosts marston 's
text: a taste for locally-brewed beers and craft ales has contributed to a sales boost at brewery and pub operator marston 's .

like-for-like sales in its drinks-led taverns division , which makes up nearly a quarter of the business , increased 1.6 % in the year to 30 september , although the company said food sales were more subdued .
the wolverhampton-based company bought 19 new pubs and eight lodges over the past year , and expects overall sales and profits to improve .
boss ralph findlay said the firm was `` well placed '' to continue its growth .

documents.title: ted baker sees strong first half
text: high street fashion chain ted baker has had a good first half to the year with both sales and profit up .
group sales rose 14 % to £ 295m while pre-tax profit jumped 18 % to £ 25.3m .
boss and founder ray kelvin said trading conditions in some of its markets `` remain challenging '' , but nonetheless it is confident of further progress in the full year .

documents.title: the cost of obesitybbc presenter sally bundock tweets :
text: the global cost of # obesity is to hit $ 1.2 trillion by 2025 .
we discuss in # bbcbizlive and ask you how would you fix it ?
how about following a country that has already fixed it ?
we are attacking this in a different way by supporting sports clubs and schools to enable greater participation .
obesity just a passing phase @ bbcbusiness
put them all on treadmills to generate power .

documents.title: longer holidays 'boost productivity '
text: lord gus o'donnell told the today programme that workers taking more holidays is n't necessarily bad for business productivity .
it comes as the office for budget responsibility is expected to say productivity in the uk is weaker than forecast , when it publishes its annual forecast evaluation report later .
he said : `` there 's quite a bit to be said for having longer holidays .

`` we 've got a high employment , low productivity position at the moment it 's not such a bad outcome , but if you compare it with somewhere like france , their productivity is much higher , and they work fewer hours . ''
the obr 's report will compare its own economic and public finance forecasts with what actually happened .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: bae cuts 'reflect defence changes '
text: as we 've already reported , bae systems is expected to announce as many as 2,000 job cuts later .
independent defence and aerospace analyst howard wheeldon says the cuts `` reflect a change in the defence programme '' .
`` britain is buying fewer jets today than it ever did before you 've got to adapt to the future , '' he tells today .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: costa coffee owner in chinese buyout
text: whitbread has taken full control of its costa coffee joint venture in china .
the ftse 100 leisure group bought the remaining 49 % stake from china 's state-owned yueda group for 310m yuan ( £ 35m ) .
the first costa store opened in shanghai a decade ago , and now there are 252 stores across the country .

alison brittain , whitbread 's chief executive , said the coffee shop market in china was `` highly attractive '' , adding : `` today 's announcement marks a significant and exciting step in our ambitious growth plans for china . ''
whitbread shares stood at £ 38.51 in morning trade .

documents.title: sky-fox deal under scrutiny
text: the competition and markets authority ( cma ) has set out more detail about what it intends to examine in its investigation into the proposed takeover of sky by 21st century fox .
the cma says it will examine how the deal would impact media plurality and broadcasting standards in the uk .
fox owns 39 % of sky but wants full control of the satellite broadcaster .
some fear the takeover would give rupert murdoch 's family , which controls fox , too much sway over the uk media .

documents.title: bumper quarter for domino 's pizza
text: domino 's pizza has had a bumper third quarter with group sales up by a whopping 20.8 % .
in the uk they rose 11.6 % , with like-for-like sales , which strip out new store openings , up 8.1 % .
boss david wild says uncertainty over the uk economic outlook means `` consumers continue to focus on value '' .
the firm , which already has over 1,000 uk stores , expects to open a further 90 stores in the uk this year .

documents.title: millennium & copthorne boosted
text: millennium & copthorne hotels shares closed 23 % higher yesterday after singapore 's city developments offered to buy the 34.8 % of the hotel company .
the bid values the uk-listed business at £ 1.8bn .
george godber , fund manager at polar capital , says the offer shows `` there are bargains to be had '' .
`` the fall in sterling is creating opportunities for business rather than just being a hindrance , '' he says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: uk still pulling in the tourists
text: one thing booming in the uk at the moment is tourism with record numbers of overseas visitors flocking over here to see the sights .
steve ridgeway , chairman of visitbritain , told the today programme : `` it 's one of the few pluses you can have at this point and we may hit the magic 40 million number this year .
`` staycations are also on the rise - that has been going on a while and can be traced back to the global financial crisis .
it is also more expensive for uk residents to go overseas . ''

with freedom of movement laws set to change after brexit , mr ridgeway added : `` a total of 70 % of tourists to the uk come from europe and we want to make sure people are welcome here and there are still reasons to come to the uk . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: obr set to publish productivity report
text: the office for budget responsibility will publish new analysis later today saying it has overestimated britain 's productivity every year since 2008 .

paul johnson , director of the institute for fiscal studies , told the today programme : `` to be fair to the obr , every other forecaster has done the same thing , as i do n't think anybody expected the productivity problem to be so consistent .
`` productivity has grown by 0 % a year since 2010 - we hoped it would get back to its historic norm of 2 % and it has completely failed to do so . ''

laura gardiner , a senior research and policy analyst at the resolution foundation , added : `` it 's a bit of a headache for the chancellor as he has reduced money to play with in the budget and with what it also means for household living standards . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: retail sales rise
text: retail sales grew last month , according to the latest figures from the british retail consortium ( brc ) and kpmg .
like-for-like retail sales , which strip out new store openings , rose 1.9 % in september .
that was far higher than the 0.4 % increase for the same month last year .
total sales climbed 2.3 % .
the brc credits much of the rise to higher prices driven up by the weak pound .

`` much of this growth is being driven by price increases filtering through , particularly in food and clothing , which were the highest performing product categories for the month , '' says brc chief executive helen dickinson .

documents.title: uk tourists rocket
text: visitbritain 's annual report is out today , showing that for the first half of this year there were a record 23.1 million overseas visits to the uk .
that 's an 8 % rise on the same period last year .

joanne hunter , co-owner of the grasmere gingerbread shop - a traditionally-run small family business in the lake district - says overseas demand has been so high that the firm has had to employ a mandarin speaker .
she said the shop 's biggest visitors used to be americans and australians , but more recently travellers from asia have rocketed .
while the lakes are famed for their incredible walks and scenery , she says there are now `` people who come here who do n't come on a walk '' because there 's so much else to do .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: bae systems job cuts loom
text: bae systems is expected to make an announcement later this morning to confirm 1,000 job cuts reported yesterday .
the cuts are expected to mainly affect its two plants in lancashire and are believed to be linked to the lack of orders for the eurofighter typhoon on which 5,000 staff work .
francis tusa , editor of trade journal defence analysis , says the cuts are `` unfortunately entirely predictable '' .
`` keeping a full production line going just is n't economic , '' he says .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: eu talks : deal or no deal
text: talks in brussels are continuing today as the fifth round of initial negotiations between the uk and european commission takes place .
douglas mcwilliams , deputy chair for the centre for economics and business research , says `` nerve endings are still raw meaning it 's hard to get a deal at this stage ''
nonetheless , he 's optimistic for the long term
`` once the frustration and agony of rejection is over then eventually sensible people will get together and there will be a deal , '' he says .
but patrick minford from cardiff business school , says no deal is n't an issue .
`` it gives us a clean slate and gets us free trade . ''
he acknowledges that some industries will lose out , but says `` they will have to raise productivity to deal will it '' .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning
text: ted baker and domino 's pizza are both reporting this morning which should give us some insight into consumer spending on the high street .
and we 've also got official trade data out at 9.30 .
we 'll keep you updated on that and more .
stay with us .
